definitions: To successfully complete or deal with a difficult period or task.
To make contact with someone by phone or other communication.
To use up or finish a supply of something.
To make someone understand something, often with difficulty.
examples: She managed to get through her exams with good grades.
I tried calling him all morning, but I couldn't get through.
We'll get through all the food by the end of the week.
It's hard to get through to him when he's so stubborn.
